timeline.bodyText: What do you mean by this?
timeline.author: jmazanec15

replies.bodyText: when cached an Index, should we verify which engine for this index, and then load the exactly library?
replies.author: luyuncheng

replies.bodyText: I see. I think we should add a different file extension for faiss graphs as opposed to nmslib graphs. Maybe .faiss_hnsw.
replies.author: jmazanec15

timeline.bodyText: I think we should keep nmslib as the default engine.

timeline.message:

upstream master merge into local master
1. FIXED SpaceType Get From IndexSettings may be EMPTY when a anonymous field create.

timeline.bodyText: Having Faiss part of NmsLibVersion class would add confusion. We should probably have dedicated enum class for Faiss versions? Intension of this class is to hold different versions of same library and refer them from this class incase we happen to maintain more than one version of the library because of compatability issues.
timeline.author: vamshin

replies.author: luyuncheng
vamshin

replies.bodyText:
We could have new enum class for FAISS that just holds FAISS versions. Example

yes, it is great. i added FAISSLibVersion in the latest commits
replies.author: luyuncheng

timeline.bodyText: We should also have some tests that create both nmslib and faiss indices and perform search in the same test and assert right values are retrieved. This is to verify we are not mixing up between library calls.
timeline.author: vamshin

replies.bodyText: yes, i would add tests for mixed engine and test with exceptions case
replies.author: luyuncheng

timeline.bodyText: package name should have version information similar to nmslib.
timeline.author: vamshin

replies.bodyText: in the latest commits, i add faiss version into package and function names.
replies.author: luyuncheng

timeline.author: vamshin

replies.bodyText:
this is may make the log of changes in KNNIndex. In KNNIndex class, it would load the specific library, if we want to pull out the methods getIndex, we need an abstraction of KNNIndex and verify the engine we are using.
Let me think about it how to do it.
replies.author: luyuncheng

replies.bodyText:
How about we pull out the methods in KNNFIndex and KNNIndex to interface so that we could refer with one object to keep it more cleaner? Something like

in the latest commits, I used KNNIndex as abstract class. KNNFaissIndex and KNNNmsLibIndex extends the KNNINdex.
KNNIndexCacheEntry only save the KNNIndex.
if you have any other idea, pls let me know
replies.author: luyuncheng

timeline.bodyText: Seems to me that knnIndex and knnFindex should inherit from some kind of abstract class.
timeline.author: jmazanec15

replies.bodyText:
I see. I think we should add a different file extension for faiss graphs as opposed to nmslib graphs. Maybe .faiss_hnsw.

in the latest commit, i use knnEngine name in the index file names like:
String hnswFileName = String.format("%s_%s_%s%s", 
    state.segmentInfo.name, 
    knnEngine.getLatestBuildVersion(),
    field.name, 
    KNNCodecUtil.HNSW_EXTENSION);


Seems to me that knnIndex and knnFindex should inherit from some kind of abstract class.

yes, you are right. let me think about how to abstract this.
replies.author: luyuncheng

replies.bodyText:
Seems to me that knnIndex and knnFindex should inherit from some kind of abstract class.

I used KNNIndex as abstract class. KNNFaissIndex and KNNNmsLibIndex extends the KNNINdex.
KNNIndexCacheEntry only save the KNNIndex.
if you have any other idea, pls let me know
replies.author: luyuncheng

replies.bodyText: I think that makes sense. Thanks for making the change!
replies.author: jmazanec15
